title: How to Clean Rusty Garden Tools With Tea

steps.headline: Make a very strong black tea.
steps.description: You will need as much tea as will cover the garden tools that you are de-rusting, so perhaps a few kettle boils might be needed. Leave it to cool down before using.

steps.headline: Pour the tea into a container such as a bucket.
Place the rust garden tools into the tea and leave to soak for a few hours.
Return later with a cleaning cloth.
steps.description: Remove the tools from the soak and rub over the rust. The rust should come off on the cloth without much effort.

steps.headline: Ensure that the tools are fully dried before placing them back in storage.

text: Make a very strong black tea. You will need as much tea as will cover the garden tools that you are de-rusting, so perhaps a few kettle boils might be needed. Leave it to cool down before using. Pour the tea into a container such as a bucket.  Place the rust garden tools into the tea and leave to soak for a few hours.  Return later with a cleaning cloth. Remove the tools from the soak and rub over the rust. The rust should come off on the cloth without much effort. Ensure that the tools are fully dried before placing them back in storage.  Finished.
